overall_summary: The reasoning employs a simple yet practical approach focused on daily seasonality and data limitations. By analyzing 4 days of hourly data, the model prioritizes avoiding overfitting through a seasonal naive method with hourly averaging. Key considerations include handling potential outliers, recognizing insufficient data for weekly patterns, and balancing simplicity against statistical complexity.
key_insights: Prioritized simplicity over complex models due to small dataset (4 days)
Used multi-day hourly averages to smooth anomalies and capture daily patterns
Recognized limitations in detecting weekly trends from short data history
Balanced outlier inclusion vs. pattern consistency in feature engineering
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex initial analysis (SARIMA/ETS consideration) transitioning to practical implementation of heuristic averaging. Features detailed pattern examination and error propagation considerations while maintaining executable simplicity.
